website_summaries.verdict: The Sonos Connect brings effortless wireless media streaming to existing hi-fi owners, but it's not the first Sonos system we'd recommend.
pros: The Sonos Connect brings the Sonos ecosystem to users who don't want a standalone speaker system
Setup is incredibly easy, and the software apps are effortless
Sound quality is good, and the digital output means it can be even better
The analog input means the system can stream analog components around your house
cons: There are other components in the Sonos range that beat it for sound quality
If you're not using it as part of a multiroom setup, it's somewhat pricey for what it does

customer_reviews.title: Classified as legacy after 3 years - Hardware is expiiring!
customer_reviews.text: This is the message I just received from Sonos: "In May the following products in your system will be classified as legacy and no longer receive software updates and new features. This will affect your listening experience. " Thousands of $ spent on a system needing to be replaced. This is a Sonos SCAM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for years, but just now being told that I'm EOL and SOL
customer_reviews.text: Another Sonos planned obsolescence product, anyone who purchased this before some time in 2015 just received an email that Sonos is going to stop supporting this, meaning no more updates, which means the moment any of your music services changes anything about how they run their API (thus needing an update), you now have a useless brick. I have a house full of Sonos gear and I will not be buying any more.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Derusha

customer_reviews.title: very convenient way to listen to music,but
customer_reviews.text: Its a very convenient way to listen to music, but frankly it is not the high quality audiophile sound that it advertised, and definitely not the same as quality as a CD. Delivery source via an I pod was markedly better. Also it does not work with Alexa also as advertised. I think they should clarify that Alexa works only with the Sonos speakers but not the Sonos Connect. There are a lot of complaints on line regarding the inability of Alexa to find and control the Sonos Connect device. The Sonos app (PC) is not intuitive, and really could be improved. The "favorites" section for example is buried and should be a simple button to access...
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Bob

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Sonos will break compatibility with this product in 2020.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned mine for slightly more than a year and it is already going to be EOLed by Sonos by May 2020.
customer_reviews.author: zer0

customer_reviews.title: Obsolete equipment
customer_reviews.text: According to Sonos this equipment was manufactured over 8 years ago, and is going out their update system because it is obsolete I would like to drop this off at UPS. Kohls is 10 miles away from me. UPS is less than a mile.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Dishonest and useless. I feel cheated.
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is one of the most dishonest companies in the audio market. I bought this to use with my iOS device and now they don’t work at all. What bull. They should be ashamed of themselves. All I can do is sell all this crap on eBay. Don’t waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: David Dworkin

customer_reviews.title: Sonos' contempt for its customers is breathtaking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon, and 3 months later Sonos announced it was too old and they were dropping support for it. You can't trust Sonos! Do not buy anything from this company!
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: No longer supporting.
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when buying Sonos Products. Very easy to use and setup. However, the company has taken a turn in 2020 and is no longer supporting older devices like this. I would consider alternatives before spending too much money on Sonos products.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this or any other sonos equipment. Sonos is stopping support on products that are only 5 years old. They can stop working completely at any time after the support has ended.
customer_reviews.author: Btodd78

customer_reviews.title: Seamless integration, better value than CONNECT AMP
customer_reviews.text: Every Sonos product I have used has been exceptional in quality and ease of use, including the CONNECT. I have the CONNECT feeding two separate Pyle amplifiers to power two sets of outdoor speakers and the seamless integration of this player with the rest of my SONOSNet is the big selling point. As a side note, I do not understand why the CONNECT AMP is so much more expensive and recommend buying this unit and a separate amp as noted above. This will save you a good chunk of money and a secondary benefit is that if the amp blows, you can just buy another one instead of having to replace/repair the entire SONOS unit.
customer_reviews.author: ANTSAMAZON

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year, then garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy. Purchased after buying a house that's got internal speakers throughout. This worked great, then after about a year it would just stop playing music after a song or two. There are dozens of various online accounts saying the same thing happens to them, but Sonos tech support says they've never heard of the issue and were no help in resolving. We've done everything - all the reboots, attaching ethernet directly, testing on single speakers, etc. It appears to be a wifi issue, but the issue seems to be within the Sonos equipment and inability to receive a signal with no solution. I received a shrug from the company so I guess I'm just out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: paddyg53

customer_reviews.title: Planned Obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: Sonos’ misguided attempt at upgrading their software has left my current system unusable in both the current software and the old software. PATHETIC. Stay away from this company. Their planned obsolescence makes investing in their very expensive products a risky proposition. If I could do it all over again I would never have invested my hard earned money on this company.
customer_reviews.author: dfwjr

customer_reviews.title: Sonos took away a key feature.  Now obsolete after 30 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given a much higher review except that Sonos made this largely obsolete with the last “upgrade”. A major reason for buying this was to play music from my home library through a central music system. This feature was removed in the last Sonos update. I would now have to replace it with the Sonos Port for another $399. I’m not sure I will go with Sonos again if they obsolete products in 30 months.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Great for Streaming Vinyl Records to Sonos Speakers / Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Sonos Connect primarily for adding Sonos to an existing stereo setup and for streaming vinyl records to all my Sonos speaker. So far this has worked fantastic for both purposes. I connected my turntable directly to the Connect via the Analog-In RCA ports, and then the Connect to my receiver via the Analog-Out RCA ports. With the Line-In Autoplay functionality, anytime I play a vinyl record it immediately begins playing on my stereo and all Sonos speakers in the same group as my Connect. The setup for all of this could not have been easier. Very pleased with the Sonos Connect.
customer_reviews.author: oa7016

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Just after buying this sonos sends a message to say it will no longer be supporting this item!! I will never buy another sonos product again. Terrible way to treat your customers
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Great for my multi-room audio system
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit my multi-room audio system. I have a HTD multi-channel preamp, connects to multi-zone Amplifier. Sonos connect works perfect as one of audio source. I can use one of the many streaming apps like Spotify, Pandora, Amazon Music, etc. or my NAS drive music library. Connect and play through the downloaded app, multiple users can control it with smart phones, MACs or PCs. App is user friendly, you can't compare the sound quality with $1000 DAC or CD transport, but it's good enough. Also comparable with Alexa and AirPlay but I haven't try.
customer_reviews.author: Sorlo

customer_reviews.title: Buggy
customer_reviews.text: Music routinely skips and frequently stops completely. I have the fastest Internet speed, my router is new and located in the same room as two speakers that frequently cut out (they all do). Sometimes, equipment disappears from my account completely and I have to re-add them. These are known issues on which Sonos’ workaround is to blame your router.
customer_reviews.author: J Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Device....
customer_reviews.text: If you're a Sonos fan you already know about the great products Sonos produces. The Sonos Connect has three Audio outs and one Input....all three Audio outs work, so you don't have to choose which one you want to use. I have the digital optical out going into a Surround Sound system and the RCA out going into an amplifier that powers outdoor speakers. For the input side I have connected the audio from my cable box which allows me to listen to the cable channel selected on the speakers outside or any of my other Sonos devices "I have four" Two Sonos Connect Amps, One Sonos Coonnect and a Sonos Play 3.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba_1963

customer_reviews.title: Great for connecting soundbar to Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love my Sonos! I have one in my studio/art room, 1 in my bathroom and I have a surround system and sound bar that I hooked up to the speakers via the Sonos connect..Yes it is a slight investment, but I love the ability to play music from various services, Pandora, iTunes, Spotify, my phone .. Its great because you can group the speakers and have the entire house filled with music as you go room to room. Or use each speaker to play individually. I used the brackets to hang the speakers on the wall, upside down which is nice bc I can adjust the volume without having to use my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki K.

customer_reviews.title: Still works like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: This is the old version of what is now the Port. I got it from amazon warehouse at a significant price reduction. It works great and has more versatility than the new Port especially if you are using an older receiver. All it lacks is Airplay2 which I have with my newer Sonos amp. Long story short it works like a charm and since Sonos updates and integrates its new and old devices well it has fit in seamlessly with my network of devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kdog

customer_reviews.title: Old School Meet Too Cool
customer_reviews.text: I think the old school box speakers connected to my front room stereo sound better and more rich and balanced than any Sonos speakers I’ve heard. Sorry, Sonos, but my “real speakers” in their wood boxes are awesome and your two Play Ones in the kitchen are only pretty good. But I can’t fit another stereo in the kitchen, so you got me there. The Connect allows me to have the old school stereo in the front room stream the same music as the pair of Play One Sonos speakers in the kitchen, as I putter and weave between the two locations. It does this flawlessly and never glitches. For that I am very grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Chuang Tzu

customer_reviews.title: Sonos Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Although I don't use the Sonos speakers, I have been using their other components for several years. I recently decided to expand the system into another room and all it took was adding this component to my sound system. Setup is very easy and updates are easier. I also like the fact that Sonos makes apps to control the system with a wide variety of devices. One of the features I really like is that you can disable the status light on the unit...I wish I could do that on all of my other electronic equipment. I normally operate my system from my Android smart phone. Although a bit on the pricey side, I don't want to be without it!
customer_reviews.author: REM

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Excellent device! Allows me to use my old AV Receiver from 1998, connected with the digital Optical cable, I can play all streaming audio services as well as old MP3 collection from my home network (i.e. NAS). In addition to this I can broadcast audio from the TV via the Sonos Connect to any other Sonos device in my house.
customer_reviews.author: M Lundblad

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing but great things to say about sonos. I have used playbars, play 1, play 3, play 5, subwoofers, connects, and amps and loved every one of them. Amazing product and great company. Installed this connect on a clients whole house audio system that was basically a Niles speaker switch being fed by an AV receiver. I put a dedicated Niles slim line amp that matches the switch in and separated the speakers selector from the AV receiver in doing so. The Niles amp turns itself on when it detects audio so the system can be turned on and off by simply using the sonos app and starting up some music. My client thinks I am God now.
customer_reviews.author: T. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for a Wireless Speaker Setup, Stop here.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sonos Connect Wireless Receiver Component to go along with the 6 Sonos Play:1's I now have for my house and all I can say is wow. The speakers are nice, but the wireless receiver itself is very easy to set up, and I no longer need my sound system for my TV. I now have surround sound system throughout my whole house for whatever I am watching, listening to, or any video game I am playing. This product is absolutely amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan Moskowitz

customer_reviews.title: Sonos - all quality and consistency
customer_reviews.text: It's rare that a Sonos component is not playing in our house. It has almost become like a utility that you always expect to be there, and work - and that is saying something. Sonos just works - at 5am when you are putting a pot of coffee on it works, at 6pm when making dinner, and at 10pm when relaxing, it just works. A bit pricey, maybe but the quality and consistency of what's delivered I will pay for that any day.
customer_reviews.author: Weary Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound in comparison to other Sonos products.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to link Sonos to my computer room. It works but the sound quality is poor. I have linked it to a tuner/amplifier and can compare sound from an analogue over the air source to the one provided by a TuneIn source for the same radio. There is no comparison. The Sonos CONNECT output sounds muffled in comparison. The quality is also poor for my own collection of music on a NAS in comparison to two Play 5s in the lounge and a Sonos playbar and woofer in the bedroom which I'm very happy with. I would not recommend this Sonos product but the others I have are great.
customer_reviews.author: Imager

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for our outdoor space
customer_reviews.text: This one device has single handedly turned our outdoor space into an amazing place. My wife and daughters love it!!! I coupled this with an old receiver that I hadn't used in years. I tied in a pair of Yamaha NASAW350W all weather speakers (55$ at Amazon warehouse deals) and the sound is unbelievable (I'm on a half acre and the sound fills the whole outdoor area). I set the volume level of the amp up to the maximum I think that we would use and then control the volume level from the sonos app. Super cool!!!! All my friends want to know what I've got (audio envy) going on.
customer_reviews.author: D. Base

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, reliable device!  Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best product for delivering all of your music from many sources to a room. This sonos connect is actually my third- I had started with one to control music in my living room, and another outside in my backyard, and now this for my kitchen. Definitely an investment but I could not be happier. The Connect is super simple to set up and always reliable- it does not suffer from connectivity issues that plague other wireless speakers/devices. The sonos app for iPhone is user friendly- and I’ve also been able to connect sonos to my Logitech harmony remotes for the ultimate in home music control with one remote.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect to synch Sonos app with Sonos speakers with your existing traditional wired system. No delay. Gave it 4 stars because price is about $100 above where it should be. But I get why they are pricing it there, those of us who already have wired system are willing to pay a premium.....rather that buy more Sonos speakers.
customer_reviews.author: EJTV

customer_reviews.title: Like all Sonos it is a great quality product but expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Like all Sonos it is a great quality product but expensive. I bought it because I had a gift card. But I still have 4 Play 1s and a sub. I got this mainly to input my PCs YouTube audio out to listen to music around home while we do Kareoke (use separate PA speaker for mic audio). Plus it streams the Sonos audio to the Bose system it is connected. Great product and easy to setup. But I think it should cost $250 and not $350+
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Bring your home stereo into the world of streaming music!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit I was a bit hesitant to jump into the Sonos environment based on $, but have become a vocal fanboy since taking the plunge. I have a pair of Sonos Ones in my office in the back of my house, & the Connect hooked up to the main system in my den. So cool to be able to control a multi-room environment from my phone! As a plus, Sonos supports HD Audio, so you can play back uncompressed FLAC files. Not to worry, Spotify sounds pretty good as well. Worth the investment IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: G. Stiller

customer_reviews.title: First to worst
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE. Discontinued product no longer supported by SONOS! This company just wrecked a system that totals close to $4K! Do NOT support these crooks! This is the best Sonos component to have if you already have a standard receiver/wired speaker sound system. It has turned my house (inside and outside) into a crowd pleasing party zone. So much fun listening to any song anybody wants to hear. The iPhone interface works flawlessly and have never had a dropout in over 2 years. Setup is simple and quick. I also added a Playbar/subwoofer/surround system in another room of my house. I am a true believer in Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: Tim M

customer_reviews.title: Will not be recognized or controlled with Apple AirPlay
customer_reviews.text: This unit serves as a receiver to run 2 passive klipsh dual 8” towers in my system. The klipsh are then grouped with my Sonos playbase and sonos sub. It has worked well with no echo from lag time. Just buy the connect allows you to use separate various amplifiers. The connect amp only has 50-55 Watts I believe and that’s not enough power for what I have. This is a perfect scenario of what you buy this sonos unit for. Bad part is it’s not picked up on apple AirPlay. So you must group it with other components. This is a big problem for me so beware.
customer_reviews.author: The Coyote

customer_reviews.title: Made me feel like I was in the music
customer_reviews.text: I have spent many tens of thousands of dollars on audio equipment and music over my life. I have had some of the best Hi Fi equipment available at the time that money could buy. Before Sonos music was great but now all I can say is that music is in color. I can close my eyes and see the music. I fully understand now why several people I know have abandoned Hi Fi equipment for Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Cuts out constantly
customer_reviews.text: And we've a fiber gigabit network that other devices have little trouble on and signal strength is typically very strong. Troubleshooting is a myriad of user-unfriendly technical articles such as "changing your wifi channel."
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect integration between digital music and any audio system
customer_reviews.text: No bugs, no problems, just a seamless integration between digital content (cloud-based, local hard drive, digital streams, etc) and your existing analog audio system. It even brought my dad's Hi-Fi into the digital age! Would have rated it 5 stars except software and firmware updates are not always optional and once updated, you cannot revert to the older version, even if the new version won't work with your older computer and/or operating system. Other than that, the system offers excellent control of the any Sonos component using iPhone, iTouch, iPad, Andriod device, PC or Mac. Use your handheld device to create playlists, control playback, select source, control volume, etc, or do it all from your desktop. Great system!
customer_reviews.author: Pete, Custom Home Remodeler

customer_reviews.title: enjoy the view and not have to get up to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a week, this thing has fixed my home house stereo system. Bluetooth hook up was not getting it done and it wasn't practical. With sonos, I do not have connection issues. I can stream and play music at the same time and I can control the stereo from any place in my house, especially the back porch where I want to sit, enjoy the view and not have to get up to change the song.
customer_reviews.author: Stic2it

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: This is the very best gadget I've bought in my limited recent memory. It was very easy to set up and I'm impressed with the quality of sound. This box connects to your local network and to your existing stereo. There is a Sonos client software that runs on your computer that controls whatever you want to listen to. It was super easy to set up. I can listen to all my own music. I also got a Pandora and Spotify subscription that works with this device. And connected it to my Amazon Cloud account so I can listen to all the music I bought from them as well. Super happy with this and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cecil Adams

customer_reviews.title: beautifully crafted and in typical Sonos fashion
customer_reviews.text: This product is aimed primarily at users who have an existing sound system already setup and simply want to have this system participate in the services offered by Sonos. This means that you can output your sonos audio (from Spotify, TuneIn, etc) into your existing system or output sound from your existing system via your own Sonos speakers. I find the device well built, beautifully crafted and in typical Sonos fashion, only has the volume up and down, and play/pause buttons. Indeed the item is pricey, but worth it especially if you have an older analog system that needs some smarts added to it.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: It worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sonos Connnect to connect to my Nuvo Essentia home audio system to be able to stream my music. It worked like a charm. I plugged the Sonos Connect in as a source and now I can control all of my music through my phone. I am able to connect to Pandora, Spotify, iHeartRadio, Amazon Music, and best of all, my Apple Music account. I can listen to any song at any time. This is game changing for me! I've been looking for something exactly like this for some time now.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy too set up works excellent with my reciever and my others sonos speakers sounds extremely awesome, now i can hear music around my whole house or use them separately AMAZING
customer_reviews.author: eddie

customer_reviews.title: A Great Device
customer_reviews.text: It's great that it handles getting my music stream directly from my wifi to my amp. Before I had to stream through my phone or laptop. Also the Sonos app on my phone controls everything.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Schoenberg

customer_reviews.title: Another great addition to my Sonos environment
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple Sonos speakers - and wanted a means to play my music library on my iPhone and Pandora through my nice AV receiver and Polk floor standing speakers. While a bit pricey this device works great. Sound quality is good, when paired with other rooms I have noticed NO delay between the different rooms.
customer_reviews.author: NKC, MO

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: Works so well with our newly installed outdoor surround sound system. Only complaint is that the volume control is not super sensitive and lags slightly. But overall really great!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: overpriced but does it's job.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for being over priced. I love sonos and they have me hijacked! I had to buy this to integrate my home theatre speakers. It's worth doing but honestly this unit should be priced at around $200. It doesn't have an amplifier it's just a sound source for your amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: ISED8

customer_reviews.title: High quality, very functional item.
customer_reviews.text: So far it has worked exactly as I had hoped. Even had to call Sonos customer service once and that was great also. Used the online help/forum a few times to get answers to questions and that also was quick and easy. This is the first time I have used a component like this and I have a couple of streaming services working and have my entire library of FLAC music files accessed through our wireless router network. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: works GREAT. The Sonos is now the only source connected ...
customer_reviews.text: Connected it to my hardwired whole-house system, works GREAT. The Sonos is now the only source connected to my system, but the Sonos itself is like having multiple sources in one -- all controlled by a convenient app on the phone (or tablet, or computer). It will play music from many any popular streaming internet services, play downloaded songs on your phone, and even play downloaded songs from other computers on your home network. I LOVE it.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Wheaton

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly; one very serious deficiency
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, and the setup was bone simple. UNFORTUNATELY, Sonos does not allow you to stream anything from iTunes that isn't downloaded to your device. Have an iCloud account and use iTunes Match? Nothing on your music list or playlist can be streamed to Sonos unless you've downloaded it to your device. This is a very serious deficiency that isn't disclosed anywhere in advance. To gain that functionality, you must buy and install an airport express, or plug your device directly into the system (thereby making the Sonos unit rather superfluous).
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth C. Howell

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this device
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Connect unit for about a week now. It took about fifteen minutes to setup from unboxing it to listening to my music. I have it connected through a distributed wireless network in my home. My music library is stored in a WD-MyCloud, which the Connect recognizes without any problem. I absolutely love this device. I replaced a WD-TV with it because I wanted a wider frequency response. It delivers rich base, full bodied mid-range and crisp high's. I plan on expanding it with some Play:3 and Play:5 speakers. The only thing I would add is some kind of approval mechanism for connecting controllers to it, similar to an Apple TV.
customer_reviews.author: csco

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: Had a Squeezebox that worked with varying levels of success. Since Logitech is big on leaving behind support for previous generations of their products, mine slowly stopped working over the past few months (software issues with no fix since development stopped). So, I decided to bite the bullet and pay more for the highly rated Sonos system. I could not be happier! Very easy to set up, no technical issues, much better and easier room synchronizing. Highly recommended. Running iPhone/iPad/Android phone apps with 1 Bridge, 2 Connects, and a Play:3. Spend the extra money, get the Sonos.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I was told this would unite all of my Sonos players and I would be able to play the sound from my TV over all of my in house speakers it not only does not work but now Sonos is saying my individual speaker players are no longer able to work. I am very disappointed in Sonos I have spent a lot on money it is $350 per room and I have 5 rooms plus this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Rabach

customer_reviews.title: Perfect user experience!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, all I can really say is wow! This sonos connect works beautifully! It looks awesome and has a feel and packaging that is as good as or better than Apples products. The setup on iPad, android and pc were the most simple, efficient and I have to say "perfect" user experiences I have ever had. If you are considering this product, do not hesitate. I purchased a connect amp three weeks later. Same thing! Great product, great company. The connect amp needs some kind of line level or headphone outputs to make it perfect but this connect went into our component stereo flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: joyce

customer_reviews.title: I have plugged my audio from the TV into the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have plugged my audio from the TV into the Sonos connect and I'm able to share that audio through all the other Sonos speakers throughout the house. The tech support told me I couldn't do that but it does work. They said I needed a different unit to be able to accomplish audio from a TV into the Sonos system.
customer_reviews.author: Cary

customer_reviews.title: A great device
customer_reviews.text: My five-years old Logitech Squeeze box died and Logitech doesn't make that device any more, so I switched to the SONOS. As much as I loved the Logitech, I love this one more because it doesn't require a PC to operate. I couldn't be more pleased with this device. I use the DAC in my NAS receiver, so I can't comment on the DAC in the SONOS. I also love the ability to control the SONOS from any Android device. And in case you're wondering, I use FLAC for all of my music library (800+ CDs).
customer_reviews.author: W. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE WITH DJ CONTROLLER.
customer_reviews.text: Connected Pioneer DJ controller to the amp and have not been able to get it to work without cutting off and intermittent sound. I have diagnosed and troubleshot the device with Sonos support. I have changed the wireless channel on the router, changed the wireless channel on the Sonos app, I have also tired compression vs uncompressed audio and it still cuts out. It seems that there is an issue with the compression software and the bandwidth that is transmitted. I will sell the device because it did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime H. Odabachian

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best bang for your buck on wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best bang for your buck on wi-fi. The software (phone app and computer app) are spot on, easy to use, and not buggy. Install was a joke and super easy over wifi. Has a built in preamp for volume control so can be directly hooked up to a amp. Tons of features and all the hookups you will need on the back in a small package. Sound quality is good not great for the DAC but I use the digital outs and use the DAC on my preamp so I appreciate the price difference compared to some other high end brands. At the price it blows everything out of the water.
customer_reviews.author: ADH

customer_reviews.title: Still not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: When it works it is great, but be prepared to spend 2-8 hours every time the software is updated with tech support trouble shooting problems. If your router goes out, then you have to reset every device in the house one at a time. Very user unfriendly. I would wait until a better product comes out. Does not work with airplay, and rarely works with music on ipad or mac. It will play internet radio great, but don't expect to play music off your iOS devices when you want to.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz Pilot

customer_reviews.title: I love Sonos
customer_reviews.text: You pay for the simplicity of set up. And it worth every penny. This connects my phono to my other Sonos speakers flawlessly. Long live rock.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Frikor

customer_reviews.title: Sonos units are very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We have had this and other Sonos components for almost two years. Sonos units are very easy to install. Software available for laptop, iPad, iPhone is easy to install. When my cordless phone rings, it sometimes disconnects the Sonos speaker. This is almost certainly a problem with the poor design of the cordless phone. Separating the units by some 10 or 12 feet seems to solve the problem. BTW, Sonos uses its own LAN system and does not use any bandwidth from your WiFi.
customer_reviews.author: JFitz

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver so that I can play distant radio stations through my stereo and so that I could stream all of my music collection. Was a little difficult to install, but Sonos' customer service was on the job at 6:30 PM & helped us all the way through. Could not be happier
customer_reviews.author: Michael L . Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from SONOS!!
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from SONOS! The discontinue supporting products that you've spent 1000s on simply to make you upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Rob From NYC

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my living room surround sound. I love having all my music in one place, playing throughout my house with the other Sonos speakers I have. The only issue I have is that this seems to be low volume. The other rooms need to be at half the volume as this one. But thats most likely something I've done with my surround sound. This is also much smaller than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: mamma me

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous after reading other reviews - but this (while expensive, I agree!) allowed us to seamlessly tie our existing stereo system (with great speakers wired into the walls) in with our Sonos speakers in other rooms throughout the house. No delay for us - as others have spoken to.
customer_reviews.author: MSH06820

customer_reviews.title: Great, robust product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Robust, very easy to install and easy to use. The only "tricky" issue I found was the installation of my iTunes library. For this specific point, the installation instructions are vague. After a few efforts I realised that the iTunes folder on my PC had to become "shareable" with the Sonos Connect before the library could be loaded. Otherwise all good!
customer_reviews.author: Ioannis Rondiris

customer_reviews.title: Delightful product, superb audio quality, but networking a bit of a pain.
customer_reviews.text: I use my Sonos to stream music from my NAS (myDitto) to my audio system. The audio quality is superb. I like the control app in my iPod and iPad, which are very intuitive. I would have liked a separate controller as well, but I'm not going to shell out so much money for the Sonos controller. Setup was relatively easy, though for some reason my Sonos didn't like my house's LAN setup. I tried to connect it to my router via a splitter, and that didn't work, so in the end I settled for connecting it to a wireless bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Data Scientist

customer_reviews.title: 5 years old and obsolete according to Sonos
customer_reviews.text: Every time they force a software update on you they screw something up. And it never gets fixed. The last update seriously messed up my my system - all 9 Play 5's and accessories about $4500 worth. After hours on the phone Sonos tells me my equip is out of date and no longer supported. Seems like the update that made my system obsolete was their way of telling me to buy all new Sonos equipment. Never, never, never again. For less than $150 I can plug an Echo Dot or Echo Input into Edifier powered speakers and get better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be much better
customer_reviews.text: I like that this product wirelessly transmitted my music files to my stereo however their was a degradation of the sound quality. Additionally, I wasn't happy that the Sonos did not recognize my 24 bit files. I returned the Sonos and purchased a Bluesound Node that remedied both of these issues. However, I imagine that if you don't have a lot of hi-res music and intend to use Sonos for internet radio than the product should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality poor
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product al all. It did connect to my older equipment with little trouble, but sound quality has rendered it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: john carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Best selling affordable network renderer
customer_reviews.text: Best selling affordable network renderer. If you have a decent amplifier and tower speakers, invest in emotiva stealth DC-1 and connect it with sonos digital output. This combination sounds great and I am using JriverMC to play all my files via ethernet from a distant media PC. Emotiva DAC sounds as good as PS audio directsteam for red book cd playback.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic System
customer_reviews.text: I've added four Sonos units to create 4 zones and I'm really pleased with the results. The system was almost too easy to setup, It was up and running within minutes of opening the boxes and I'm using multiple PC's and Android phones as controllers without any problems. One of my links is over 100' though multiple rooms so I bought a Bridge to put in the middle. I've had this working for over a month now and the Bridge is still in the box; the system is working great without it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill H.Top Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Streaming went flaky after 6 months...
customer_reviews.text: Tossing the unit. I have been working with support for months and the unit is still failing to consistently stream from any provider. Sonos support is slow to respond and laborus. The engineers I worked with were great but the product is defective.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Sonos is the best electronics product I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: It's that simple -- Sonos is the best electronics product I have ever purchased. Super easy interface. It freed all of my stored music from the clunky interface I had previously been using. And, I've added a bunch of free and some paid services, so I now have basically all of the music in the world literally at my finger tips. Everyone who can afford one should get a Sonos. (It is a little pricey, but there's really no comparable product I've seen.)
customer_reviews.author: C Lahno

customer_reviews.title: Lazy, inaccurate tech support
customer_reviews.text: You have to get through to a human and have him/her walk you through the setup. You can't rely on the enclosed Quick Setup Guide, which is misleading and not descriptive enough to successfully guide you..
customer_reviews.author: bjgroup

customer_reviews.title: Get this system!
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a home sound system then get one of these. If you do or thinking of getting a whole home audio still get this. I run the music off this and is incredible for me. Has radio stations like Pandora. You can steam music from phone but when you leave the house it will stop. If you are playing radio stations it will keep playing for the family while you run to town or what not. Awesome product! App is so easy
customer_reviews.author: trev_151

customer_reviews.title: SONOS is the Best Sound System - Period
customer_reviews.text: I've had SONOS for about 5 years now and it simply is the best. The app, which controls SONOS, is easy to use and they are always making upgrades to the performance. I use this connect in my basement where I have a full sound system with a separate amplifier. It works great! I also bring this receiver and the connect outside for our annual block party. All around this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is a bit expensive but it is worth the money spent on it. I bought this product so I could connect my turntable to it. Connection was very easy and the sound coming through my sono speaker is great. I have had no issues with WiFi connectivity or sounds issues.
customer_reviews.author: Piloboysdad

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: If I could return I would. Spent so much money and it did not solve my issues.
customer_reviews.author: JANINE LOW

customer_reviews.title: Great system!
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is a great system to provide music throughout one's home. The setup was very easy, and we haven't had any problems in the 6 months while using this system. The individual parts of Sonos are sleek looking and match our furniture and sound system well. The sound quality is great. The Sonos software is decent and we like the ability to stream various internet radio stations for free. While expensive, I haven't found any systems that work like this and is as versatile. The only thing I would change would be able to use my computer speakers when I have the Sonos software loaded to play the music.
customer_reviews.author: rg-s

customer_reviews.title: Love love love SONOS
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with the Sonos system. This replaced my much loved but discontinued and no longer supported Logitech squeezebox. This device is absolutely incredible. I love the fact that I can set up zones and play dance music out by the pool, but have 'zen' music playing in the house. I love that I now have a true surround tv sound with a magnificent sub that rocks my china cabinet. What a fab system.
customer_reviews.author: joy to the world

customer_reviews.title: Cool product.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool product. Extremely easy to set up. I pull my iTunes library off my. I use both the iPhone and the android clients to control the music queue. Both are extremely easy to use. Setup of the box was cake. One caveat: I really didn't like the sound I got at first out of my high end analog receiver.so, I bought aand that made it sound a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It works just as I hoped it would. I connected my surround sound speakers as well as three other stations throughout my house. I’m able to control it through my phone anywhere in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne F

customer_reviews.title: The Convenience and Flexibility are Worth the Price of Admission
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Sonos Connect. Each is connected to a separate high quality two channel audio system. I also have a Sonos Play 3 and a Boost. I've found all Sonos components to be easy to set-up and use. No problems whatsoever. The sound is good, better if you use a high quality external DAC with the Connect. Is it reference quality? No. But... the convenience, variety of music available and flexibility are worth the price of admission. Internet radio, Spotify, TuneIn and SiriusXM (via internet) compatible. Many other services too. I still spin CDs and vinyl for critical listening because there is a difference in sound quality. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough GOOD things
customer_reviews.text: We moved into a house with a built in breathe audio system but it was hooked up in the store-room in the basement. Because it was so far away, it was basically hook up an ipod, cd, or radio for music. Then I found Sonos, this is literally the coolest tech toy I've bought in the past year (and I buy a lot of them). The music quality is excellent. Took literally 3 minutes to teach my family to use it also, which is a huge bonus (they are not very tech saavy).
customer_reviews.author: MelissaS

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!  A bit overpriced!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product! A bit overpriced...but, nothing else comes close to doing what it can
customer_reviews.author: Carl Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Sonos Connect for an retired couple that recently downsized. They were very happy that we were able to get rid of most of the components that had been a part of their audio system for many years. In just two hours I was able to set up their existing receiver and speaker, plug in and configure the Sonos Connect, download the app to their iPhone and iPads, and even teach them how to use it. On a second visit, I walked in to hear the living room filled with music, and see smiles on their faces. The retirees like it so much that they have since bought 2 Sonos Play units. Small investment...big big returns.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Thommas

customer_reviews.title: these are expensive AND worth it
customer_reviews.text: i have 4 of these now, and they are reliable and stable and allow me to direct stream from Deezer and other services to my room or multi room systems
customer_reviews.author: paulandpaula

customer_reviews.title: Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: Quality sound with hard-wired in ceiling speakers in this age of “wireless”.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H. Donnell

customer_reviews.title: This is my second unit and it works great. Not sure though what type of AV connection ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second unit and it works great. Not sure though what type of AV connection works better between coax and optical. I guess with a higher end audiophile grade sound system you would be able to tell. Just read that you don't need a Bridge unit anymore for connecting to your wifi and Bridge would only be necessary when your wifi is less than perfect. However, Bridge is been replaced by a brand new wifi booster called Boost
customer_reviews.author: omar contreras

customer_reviews.title: Good luck if you live in a city with lots of "wireless intereference"
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device to connect my turntable and/or CD player to my two Sonos speakers. I have a small apartment with the router maybe about 8-10ft from the Sonos devices. The turntable/CD audio from skips or pauses intermittently. After reviewing threads and talking to Sonos support, it was because I am in an apartment building (in NYC, mind you) with too much wireless interference, so no matter what channel I switch on my router, the audio will go in and out unless I compress the music (with Connect, you have the option for compressed or uncompressed line-in streaming.) So basically I spent $350 on a device to hear -compressed- analog music on high quality speakers. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Sonos cant be beat
customer_reviews.text: Sonos has and is a great Product, streaming music options are plentiful line input and app make it very flexible and easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Mike Gavette

customer_reviews.title: Not a speaker!
customer_reviews.text: People this is not a speaker! Very expensive and you have to buy other materials to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Robinson

customer_reviews.title: needs a rack mounted multichannel version which can serve as ...
customer_reviews.text: needs a rack mounted multichannel version which can serve as a hub for folks with automation systems. The control4 integration is weak as hell and needs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Kishore

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great reliable product. I bought two for our church. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This unit is super easy to setup and works great
customer_reviews.text: This unit is super easy to setup and works great. I have it hard wired to my network and it's flawless. It also has two outputs which work simultaneously. Fiber and RCA. I needed both to feed my home theater amp and my whole house audio controller. The music does sound a bit fuller when I plug my iPhone directly into the amps, but not by much.
customer_reviews.author: Dom F

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: makes I it east to share music in any room of my house through my multi room audio system. its the first time the system has been truly usable because I can now control the music from anywhere. My daughter loves the ease of creating playlists too.
customer_reviews.author: PACE

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey, but now my Presonus Eris 5 studio reference monitors are part of my Sonos system! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Keith G. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Sonos is a great music streaming device. This is the second one I've bought to add an additional zone control in my house. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Marc C.

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Stable
customer_reviews.text: Really wonderful device! I have been wondering for a while if there was "something" that I could hook up to my existing 2 channel Onkyo integrated amp and Klipsch speakers that would allow me to stream awesome music. This is it! I can't emphasize how simple this device is and how consistently well it operates. It is solid. I haven't yet tried any of the Sonos speakers but looking forward to it and see how well it will work with my current system.
customer_reviews.author: Eti Moskowitz

customer_reviews.title: We stream TuneIn, Pandora and Calm Radio - classical ...
customer_reviews.text: We stream TuneIn, Pandora and Calm Radio - classical, jazz, blues, and many NPR music stations. The iPhone is the remote for our vintage audiophile stereo.This was a worthwhile purchase that's brought us hours of listening pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sprat

product_meta.title: Sonos Connect - Wireless Home Audio Receiver Component for Streaming Music - White
product_meta.description:
Style:CONNECT| Color:Light GrayThe Sonos Connect brings streaming music to your stereo or home theater. Setup is easy, and you can play music on the connected speakers alone or throughout your house with Sonos speakers in every room. Wirelessly stream your entire music library and favorite online music services, and control it all with a free app on your phone, tablet, or computer. Analogue audio input.

REVIEW FROM HOME THEATER MAGAZINE


REVIEW FROM HOMETHEATERMAG.COM: SONOS
It's hard to overstate the simplicity of the Sonos system concept. There are three basic Sonos bricks: two audio players (the ZonePlayer 90 and ZonePlayer 120) and one handheld wireless Sonos Controller 100. The Bundle 150 includes one of each. Read the full review at HomeTheaterMag.com.

>  > Visit HomeTheaterMag.com for more product news and reviews
feature_bullets: The simple streaming update to your stereo or receiver. Add connect to stream with your existing stereo then easily expand your Sonos system to more rooms
Enjoy music, podcasts, audiobooks, and internet radio with your amplified audio equipment. You can also stream vinyl, CDs, and stored audio files to Sonos speakers in other rooms of your home
The Sonos app brings all your streaming services together, so you can get to the music you want quicker and control the sound in every room
Use the line in to connect your turntable, or play music straight from a friend's phone on your stereo. Auto-switching 100-240 V, 50-60 hertz AC universal input

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars908 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
